stream_context.summary: Kaze builds and refines Course 11 (Bowser’s Oil Rig) by modelling moving platforms, experimenting with colour/lighting, and debugging a broken zip-line mechanic. He also discusses upcoming multiplayer work and overall project scope.

development_findings.summary: Course 11 is an oil-rig stage inspired by Mario Sunshine’s Rico Harbor, focused on fast, skill-heavy platforming rather than puzzles.
development_findings.quote: I added a lot of fog … Rico Harbor is a little bit the inspiration for this level.

development_findings.summary: New platform types created: left-right sliders, in-out sliders, rotating cranes, shrinking barrel platform, hook movers, and a seesaw oil tank.
Zip-lines will connect buildings, but their visual language is unsolved; Kaze worries players won’t recognise them.
development_findings.quote: The problem … is that if we do that, it’s going to be hard for players to tell what is a zip line and what is not.

development_findings.summary: Cannons will act as optional shortcuts between towers, emphasising player freedom.
development_findings.quote: They’re just there to explore the level faster. If you die from the cannon shot, you’re just gonna … climb up somewhere else.

development_findings.summary: Lighting overhaul: added a camera-based light (inspired by Mario Odyssey) to brighten moving objects; some shaders still need patching.
development_findings.quote: I added the light coming from the camera back … makes the whole game look a lot brighter.

development_findings.summary: Collision-finder optimisation introduced months ago broke zip-lines; a misplaced bracket offset the ceiling raycast by 80 units. Bug was located and fixed on-stream.
development_findings.quote: I messed up the code and I actually never tested it … and I just did. It took me like five minutes.

development_findings.summary: N64 clip-ratio tweak improves FPS but causes far-triangle glitches; Kaze may revert or debug further.
development_findings.quote: Clip ratio gives us a few more FPS, but it also causes all of this to happen.

development_findings.summary: Course-11 retro pipe will lead to a Smash 64 ‘Board the Platforms’ homage.
development_findings.quote: The retro pipe will be Smash 64 board to platforms.

development_findings.summary: Planned courses after 11: comic-book world, Wild West valley (Course 12), casino world, plus one more.
Kaze plans to add split-screen multiplayer during a two-week work vacation in late June.
development_findings.quote: In those two weeks, I might add multiplayer with split-screen.

development_findings.summary: All OST tracks are custom compositions by Badub (with some Mario remixes), preventing DMCA issues.
development_findings.quote: All of the OST is custom made by Badub, so it actually is not copyrighted.

development_findings.summary: Optimisation branch (custom ‘libultra’ replacement) will eventually be open-sourced and maybe back-ported to vanilla SM64.
development_findings.quote: I’m gonna open source it and I might back-port all my optimisations to the vanilla game.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes giving players toggles for core mechanics; sees it as design abdication.
context_findings.quote: I’m kind of against giving players options … I don’t think I want an option for that one.

context_findings.summary: He values perceived freedom; refuses aim-assist lines for cannons.
context_findings.quote: Games should be about experiencing freedom … If it was me, I would purposefully not do the line.

context_findings.summary: Coding philosophy: write fast, rarely test, fix regressions later to save time.
context_findings.quote: I never test my code. I just assume it works … it saves me a lot of time.

context_findings.summary: Moved streaming from Twitch to YouTube due to intrusive ads; wants viewers ad-free.
context_findings.quote: On YouTube, at least I can decide whether there’s ads or not.

context_findings.summary: Personal dynamic: playful on-stream banter with spouse Zeina; she voices concerns about week-long ‘life’ streams and handles household tasks.

biobak.summary: Suggested colour directions (e.g., ‘Biobak pink’) and influenced oil colour palette discussion.

badub.summary: Provides fully custom soundtrack, allowing streams and releases without copyright strikes.

zeina.summary: Animating Bowser boss; presented a new walk-cycle and received design feedback (head locked on Mario).
zeina.quote: In-game, you have to imagine he will always be looking at Mario during this.

zeina.summary: Participates in stream planning; raises practical concerns about extended dev streams and daily cooking.
zeina.quote: If you gotta stream all day for a week, at least give me a moment to prepare so I don’t have to cook every day.

key_stories.title: Zip-line Regression Hunt
key_stories.summary: While demonstrating Course 11, Kaze discovers Mario no longer grabs zip-lines.
key_stories.challenge: An earlier collision-finder optimisation broke ceiling detection, so zip-lines stopped registering.
key_stories.process: Used in-game death breakpoints, ceiling-height prints, and code review to locate a misplaced bracket that offset raycasts.
key_stories.outcome: Bug fixed within minutes; platform mechanic restored.
key_stories.key_quote: I messed up the code and I actually never tested it … and I just did. It took me like five minutes.

key_stories.title: Lighting Epiphany
key_stories.summary: After watching Mario Odyssey footage, Kaze realises his hack looks too dark.
key_stories.challenge: Scenes were hard to read; Mario appeared dim.
key_stories.process: Restored a camera-origin light source, tweaked ambient values, and live-tested in dark caves.
key_stories.outcome: Brighter, more readable visuals; some objects still need per-material fixes.
key_stories.key_quote: Even dark cave levels now look not that grim.

key_stories.title: Colour Palette Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Initial red-orange oil texture resembled lava and confused testers.
key_stories.challenge: Players mistook oil platforms for burning ash; colours felt ‘off’.
key_stories.process: Live texture edits, hue/saturation tweaks, consultation with chat and Biobak, tested alternative purples/blues.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on richer blue-purple steel with orange lighting; further refinement planned.
key_stories.key_quote: Some of the colours in this level just kind of … they don’t make me go rock hard.

key_stories.title: Multiplayer Sprint Plan
key_stories.summary: Kaze announces intent to add split-screen multiplayer.
key_stories.challenge: Feature scope large; limited dev time.
key_stories.process: Reserves two-week work vacation for coding marathon, possibly streaming daily ‘life-on-cam’.
key_stories.outcome: Not started yet; Zeina lobbying for preparation time.
key_stories.key_quote: We start in the morning, I just live my life on stream for a week, and we finish the split-screen multiplayer.
